intro: Maasia multinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined maasia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct network of veins, contributing to its scientific name. Maasia multinervis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
